name: unbuffered
content:
unbuffered adjective
(COMPUTING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
computing
  specialized Unbuffered information, or an unbuffered part of a computer system, does not use a buffer (= a temporary memory store for information while it is being dealt with or sent): Channels are message queues which can be buffered or unbuffered.
More examplesFewer examplesThe unbuffered solid state memory block holds a capacity of 4096 bytes.Access location will either be unbuffered on-disc or cached. They require registered modules that are both slower and more expensive than unbuffered types.

unbuffered adjective
(CHEMICAL SUBSTANCE)
chemistry
  specialized An unbuffered substance is not mixed with another substance to make it neutral (= neither an acid nor an alkali): An unbuffered pocket of highly acidic juice is observed in the stomach after a meal in healthy subjects.
More examplesFewer examplesThe samples were dissolved in unbuffered dilute acetic acid. For each subject, the unbuffered local anaesthetic was used in one eye, while the buffered solution was used in the other eye. There were no significant differences between the buffered and unbuffered lidocaine.
